back_cards.definition_en: To a great extent or degree
back_cards.example_en: She enjoyed the party so much that she stayed until midnight.
There was much excitement in the office about the new project.
He doesn't visit much, but when he does, it's always fun.
This hike is much harder than the last one we did.
It costs much the same as the other brand.
Someone left their jacket on the bus.

back_cards.definition_en: A person of importance or interest
back_cards.example_en: She's someone you should meet at the conference.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to a person in a story
back_cards.example_en: Someone was knocking on the door late at night.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in a general sense
back_cards.example_en: You need someone to help with the heavy lifting.
Someone called the office but didn't leave a name.
The movie had a surprising twist at the end.

back_cards.definition_en: The conclusion of an event or period
back_cards.example_en: Summer camp comes to an end next week.
The fence marks the end of our property.
Her end in studying was to become a doctor.
The project reached its end after months of work.
She decided to change her hairstyle for the event.

back_cards.definition_en: To replace one thing with another
back_cards.example_en: I need to change the batteries in the remote.

back_cards.definition_en: To shift to a different state or situation
back_cards.example_en: The weather can change quickly in the mountains.
Can you change a twenty-dollar bill for me?
They had to change their travel plans due to the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to introduce a statement that contrasts
back_cards.example_en: It was raining; however, we went hiking anyway.
However you cook it, the dish tastes amazing.
However tired she was, she finished the report.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express surprise or emphasis
back_cards.example_en: However did you manage to fix the car so fast?

back_cards.definition_en: As a transition to a different point
back_cards.example_en: The plan seemed good; however, it was too expensive.
She was the only person who arrived on time.
It’s only a five-minute walk to the park.
I saw her only yesterday at the store.
We can only carry two bags on the flight.
You can join, only if you finish your homework.

back_cards.definition_en: In the vicinity or area of
back_cards.example_en: There are many shops around the town square.
The meeting starts around noon.
We walked around the lake to enjoy the view.
She looked around the room for her keys.
They put a fence around the garden.
The drive to the beach takes about an hour.
The store closes at the hour of midnight.

back_cards.definition_en: A designated time for an activity
back_cards.example_en: Office hours are from nine to five.
She spent an hour practicing the piano.
We’ll arrive within the hour, so get ready.
Everything in the store was on sale.
To her, family is everything.
Everything went wrong during the trip.
Have you packed everything for the hike?
Everything about the festival was magical.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to a nation as a whole
back_cards.example_en: The national anthem was played before the game.

back_cards.definition_en: Owned or maintained by the government
back_cards.example_en: We visited a national park during our vacation.
She joined the national team for the Olympics.

back_cards.definition_en: Of widespread importance in a country
back_cards.example_en: The election was a national event.
The dish is a national treasure in their culture.
